name: Pistachio-Crusted Salmon
author: France C
summary: Make ordinary salmon extra special by topping it with a pistachio crust. You can have it on the table in under 30 minutes for a quick weeknight meal or a dinner party for guests. Serve with a chilled glass of Sauvignon Blanc.
ingredients: 4 (6 ounce) fillets salmon with skin, center cut
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Combine pistachios, panko bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and butter in a small bowl; stir with a fork until evenly combined
Lightly season salmon fillets with salt and pepper on both sides
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat
Sear salmon fillets, flesh-side down, for 2 to 3 minutes
Turn heat off and flip salmon pieces over so skin side is down
Brush tops of salmon evenly with Dijon mustard
Top with pistachio mixture, pressing mixture down onto salmon
Bake in the preheated oven until salmon flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 12 minutes
